title: Israeli spy chief's accusations against Netanyahu raise political crisis to new peak
summary: Ronen Bar, head of the Shin Bet, Israel's domestic intelligence agency, who was dismissed by the government, has submitted a statement to the Supreme Court accusing Benjamin Netanyahu of breaching the rule of law.

title: Pope Francis' funeral turns Rome into the center of the world
summary: The burial ceremony for the pontiff on Saturday is taking on the air of a grand diplomatic gathering. A total of 160 foreign delegations are expected at Saint Peter's Square in Rome, reflecting the Vatican's influence on the international stage as well as the commitments of the late Argentine pope.

title: Rwanda, DR Congo set goal for peace deal draft amid lingering suspicion on both sides
summary: A joint declaration signed in the presence of Secretary of State Marco Rubio committed the two countries to come up with an 'initial draft peace agreement' by May 2.

title: Three French jihadists held in Iraq to be repatriated, justice minister says
summary: Justice Minister Gerald Darmanin told a local newspaper that the three detainees from northern France, who had been sentenced to death in Iraq, then jailed for life, would be returned. So far, he gave no details about how any repatriations would take place.

title: PSG's shock loss after Nice wins 3-1, halting the team's undefeated season
summary: PSG, who had already secured a fourth consecutive Ligue 1 title at the start of this month, now falls short of equalling the record for the longest unbeaten run from the beginning of a French season.

title: Abidjan, the other capital of French rap
summary: While Kaaris, born in Côte d'Ivoire, headlined the Anoumabo Urban Music Festival, the whole avant-garde of young Franco-Ivorian artists like Le Juiice, Lala & ce, Laylow, Jeune Lion and Jok'Air are splitting their time between the two countries.

title: FBI arrests US judge for allegedly obstructing an immigration arrest
summary: FBI Director Kash Patel accused Judge Hannah Dugan of having 'intentionally misdirected federal agents away from' an undocumented migrant they sought to detain, in a post on X, which he has since deleted.

title: Trump calls for Ukraine and Russia to meet for talks 'at very high levels,' says they are 'close to a deal'
summary: In an interview with 'Time' magazine, the US president said the territory in southern Ukraine had been 'given' to Russia by Barack Obama in 2014.

title: US envoy Witkoff and Putin discuss direct Russia-Ukraine talks
summary: As United States Special Envoy Steve Witkoff met with Russian President  Vladimir Putin, the 'possibility' of direct talks between Ukraine and Russia came up, though such talks have not been held since February 2022.

title: Tesla struggles in China as market share collapses
summary: By focusing on design and performance, the American manufacturer was a pioneer in getting Chinese motorists to adopt electric cars. Although 40% of its sales are now in China, Tesla has become a minor player, constantly forced to adapt.

title: France is massively rejecting Russian visa applications over espionage fears
summary: Paris has denied 1,200 visas and accreditations for diplomats or 'speakers' wishing to attend conferences, aiming to prevent Moscow from rebuilding an intelligence network decimated by the expulsion of agents operating under diplomatic cover.

title: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to federal charges of murdering health insurance CEO
summary: Luigi Mangione, 26, has been charged in both state and federal courts for allegedly killing CEO Brian Thompson, with federal prosecutors seeking the death penalty. The case has sparked much outcry about US healthcare.

title: School knife attack in western France: Prosecutor says suspect had no clear motive
summary: After a stabbing attack in a high school killed a 15-year-old girl and injured three other pupils, the prosecutor spoke about the suspect, a student, saying he was 'solitary' but that no 'certain' motive had been found.

title: Macron decides not to revoke Sarkozy's Legion of Honor
summary: The president announced on Thursday that he 'will not make any decision' to remove his predecessor's honor, despite his definitive conviction and prison sentence.

title: Huge crowds pack Vatican for last day of Pope's lying in state
summary: Around 150,000 people paid their last respects to Pope Francis, before the funeral, held on Saturday, April 26. The pontiff's coffin was closed at 8 pm local time, in a ceremony attended by senior cardinals.

title: Paris residents fight to save a beloved but neglected mosaic
summary: Built in 1987 in the heart of a working neighborhood in the 18th arrondissement, a brick and ceramic fresco by artist Charles Gianferrari is threatened by an urban renovation project.

title: Higher breast cancer risk among more educated women, study finds
summary: Later and fewer pregnancies, as well as alcohol consumption, partially explain the phenomenon, according to a large study involving over 300,000 women.

title: French EY employees vote to go back to 48-hour workweek
summary: After an agreement allowed employees to work up to 58-hour weeks, the firm's unions asked its employees for their opinions, and 97% of respondents wished to re-establish the 48-hour workweek time limit.

title: Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre dies by suicide in Australia, family confirms
summary: Giuffre's lawyer, Sigrid McCawley, said the US and Australian citizen had been a 'dear friend' and a champion for other victims: 'Her courage pushed me to fight harder, and her strength was awe-inspiring.'

title: What Pope Francis leaves behind through his political, fraternal and poetic writings
summary: During his 12 years as pontiff, Pope Francis published numerous texts that left a mark on the world with their universal and radical reach, as well as on the life of the Church through the profound changes they inspired.

title: War in Ukraine: Here is what Kyiv's allies and opponents propose to obtain peace
summary: Diplomatic initiatives are multiplying to end the conflict, but significant disagreements persist among Ukrainians, Russians, Americans and Europeans regarding the conditions for a lasting peace.

title: Thousands of faithful flood the Vatican for Pope Francis's funeral
summary: The funeral mass will begin at 10 am in St. Peter's Square. The pope's coffin will then be transferred to the Basilica of St. Mary Major in central Rome, the first time this has happened for a pontiff in 300 years.

title: Pope Francis's funeral in photos
summary: The funeral is taking place on the steps of Saint Peter's Basilica on Saturday, attended by presidents, heads of government and monarchs, including Donald Trump and Emmanuel Macron. The pope will then be interred in the Basilica of Saint Mary Major.

title: French films are still very popular in Russia
summary: In 2024, Russia was the second-largest market for French films globally, just behind Germany.

title: US holds third round of high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran
summary: US special envoy Steve Witkoff, who arrived in Oman for talks on Saturday, last met Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on April 19. The first meeting was held on April 12.

title: Zelensky and Trump agree to second talk after 'constructive' exchange at pope's funeral
summary: The Ukrainian president spoke with his American counterpart on the sidelines of Pope Francis's funeral on Saturday.

title: Women's Six Nations: France face their nemesis in the 'final'
summary: The French women's rugby team faces the formidable English team on Saturday at Twickenham. The team that wins the match will claim the tournament and leave a mark just months before the World Cup.

title: At leasts 280 people injured by explosion in Iranian port
summary: The blast happened at the Rajaei port on Saturday morning.Social media videos showed black billowing smoke after the blast. Authorities have offered no cause for the explosion so far.
